elements.title: WPD Intraflex
elements.description: Western Power Distribution's IntraFlex lowers entry barriers to owners of assets such as EV chargers, permitting them to dip into Britain's expanding market for flex trading.

elements.title: ESO, DNOs and local councils news from the UK
elements.description: The UK Government and energy regulator Ofgem have outlined their initial views on [replacing National Grid](https://www.edie.net/news/11/National-Grid-could-lose-electricity-system-operator-role-under-new-BEIS-and-Ofgem-plans/) with a new independent system operator for electricity and gas, as part of a string of policy updates designed to accelerate the low-carbon transition. Meanwhile UK Power Networks and Northern Powergrid [outline £7.7bn investment plans](https://www.edie.net/news/10/Net-zero-energy-transition--UK-Power-Networks-and-Northern-Powergrid-outline--7-7bn-investment-plans/). Whilst a report from the NAO [published on July 16th](https://www.edie.net/news/11/-Serious-weaknesses--in-UK-Government-s-plans-for-engaging-local-councils-on-net-zero--report-warns/) revealed that 91% of the UK’s local authorities have set at least one climate commitment but finding it hard to engage with the UK Government.

elements.title: Flexible Power
elements.description: Western Power Distribution, SP Energy Networks, Scottish and Southern Electricity Networks and Northern Powergrid have announced they are collaborating on 'Flexible Power' to signpost and operate all of their flexibility requirements. [In the news, Oct 2020](https://theenergyst.com/four-dnos-collaborate-to-streamline-flexibility-across-networks/)

elements.title: SAVE
elements.description: SAVE is a five-year trial across 4,000 homes in the Solent region called SAVE, which tried a range of mechanisms to see how households could provide demand reduction and response. From the [Energyst](https://theenergyst.com/sse-networks-to-bring-households-into-demand-side-response/)
